Activity2.Description: EMERGENCY CARE: ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER OFFERS A 24-HOUR PER DAY LEVEL II EMERGENCY CARE FACILITY. SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE MEDICAL, SURGICAL, ETC. TOTAL VISITS = 29,500

Activity3.Description: SURGICAL CARE: PROVIDES ALL SERVICES (EXCEPT OPEN HEART) TO PATIENTS RANGING FROM INFANT TO GERIATRICS WHO NEED SURGICAL INTERVENTION. TOTAL HOURS = 5,913

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER IS A 233-BED ACUTE CARE FACILITY THAT OFFERS THE BEST OF MEDICAL TECHNOLOGY, PREVENTIVE SERVICES AND A "WHOLE PERSON APPROACH" IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF THE ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY AREA.
IRS990.MissionDescription: ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER IS A 233 BED ACUTE CARE FACILITY THAT OFFERS THE BEST OF MEDICAL TECHNOLOGY, PREVENTIVE SERVICES AND A "WHOLE PERSON APPROACH" TO MEETING THE NEEDS OF THE ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY AREA.ST. MARYS REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER OFFERS A FULL RANGE OF INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT SERVICES TO MEET THE GROWING AND CHANGING NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. OUR PROFESSIONAL, QUALIFIED STAFF ARE ABLE TO DELIVER CARDIOPULMONARY, LABORATORY, NURSING, PHYSICAL THERAPY, RADIOLOGY, SOCIAL AND SURGICAL SERVICES WITH THE PERSONALIZED TOUCH DESIGNED TO MAKE OUR PATIENTS FEEL MORE RELAXED AND AT HOME.
IRS990.Description: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH: ST. MARYS OFFERS THE MOST ADVANCED BEHAVIORAL HEALTHCARE DIAGNOSTIC AND TREATMENT SERVICES FOR CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS AND ADULTS IN BOTH INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT PROGRAMS. INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT TREATMENTS INCLUDE COMPREHENSIVE PSYCHIATRIC ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATIONS, EDUCATION, INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP THERAPY, INDIVIDUALIZED BIO-PSYCHOSOCIAL TREATMENT PLAN AND DISCHARGE AND AFTERCARE PLANNING.TOTAL PATIENT DAYS = 18,307

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER IS A MEMBER OF THE MAINE HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION AND A PORTION OF THE DUES PAID IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,617 IS USED FOR LOBBYING.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: CONTINUING EDUCATION CAPITAL PURCHASES FOR SPECIFIC SPECIALITIES
TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED INVESTMENT INCOME 24,648. DONATIONS 469,782. STOCK LOSS - RESTRICTED FUND -402,501. EXPENSE RECLASS 716,065.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.Explanation: PART II: IN RESPONSE TO THE SIGNIFICANT NEEDS AROUND NUTRITION, POVERTY AND FOOD ACCESS FOR THE COUNTY, ST. MARYS HEALTH SYSTEM FOUNDED THE NUTRITION CENTER OF MAINE IN 2006. THROUGH ORGANIZING, ADVOCACY AND EDUCATION, THE CENTER IS A LOCAL AND STATEWIDE RESOURCE, PROMOTING OVERALL COMMUNITY WELLNESS THROUGH NUTRITION, YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINABLE URBAN AGRICULTURE PROGRAMS. MANY OF THE CONSTITUENTS ARE AT HIGH RISK FOR HUNGER, OBESITY AND NUTRITION-RELATED DISEASES. IN 2010 THE FOOD PANTRY DISTRIBUTED 13,947 BOXES OF FOOD, PROVIDING ENOUGH FOOD FOR 26,560 PEOPLE. EIGHTY COMMUNITY GARDENERS GREW FOOD AT LOCAL COMMUNITY GARDENS AND EIGHT WORKSHOPS WERE HELD TO EDUCATE GARDENERS. THE NUTRITION CENTER HELD 128 COOKING AND NUTRITION CLASSES AND INITIATED THE SOMALI NUTRITION INITIATIVE WHICH HAS ALREADY EDUCATED MORE THAN 286 SOMALI AND SOMALI-BANTU WOMEN. EIGHTEEN YOUTH CONTRIBUTED 2253 TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE YOUTH GARDENER PROGRAMS WHICH OFFER UNIQUE EDUCATION, LEADERSHIP AND JOB-TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES. YOUTH AGES 14-20 ENGAGE IN MEANINGFUL WORK WHILE LEARNING JOB PREPAREDNESS, HOW TO GARDEN, HOW TO COOK HEALTHY FOOD AND HOW TO CREATE POSITIVE CHANGE IN THEIR COMMUNITY.IN ADDITION, SMHS LEADERSHIP MEMBERS SERVE ON THE LOCAL CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND OTHER COMMUNITY COALITIONS RELATED TO COMMUNITY HEALTH SUCH AS THE MAINE HEALTHCARE ACTION TEAM AND THE MAINEHEALTH ELDER CARE TEAM, AS WELL AS WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS SUCH AS THE COLLEGE FOR ME STEERING COMMITTEE, AND THE HEALTHCARE WORKFORCE FORUM WHICH REPORTS ITS EFFORTS TO ASSURE AVAILABILITY OF A HEALTHCARE WORKFORCE TO THE STATE LEGISLATURE.
PART III, LINE 4: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT INCLUDE A FOOTNOTE THAT DESCRIBES BAD DEBT EXPENSE. THE AMOUNTS REPORTED ABOVE ARE CALCULATED BASED ON A RATIO OF COST TO CHARGES.
PART III, LINE 8: APPROXIMATELY 33% OF MEDICARE PATIENTS ALSO QUALIFY FOR MEDICAID. COSTING ON LINE 6 IS BASED ON RATIO OF COST TO CHARGE FROM WORKSHEET 2.
PART III, LINE 9B: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A SEPARATE CHARITY CARE POLICY FROM ITS CREDIT AND COLLECTION POLICIES.

PART VI, LINE 2: IN ORDER TO ENSURE OUR EFFORTS ADDRESS IDENTIFIED NEEDS IN THE COMMUNITY, ST. MARYS HEALTH SYSTEM AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES ELICITED THE VOICE OF THE COMMUNITY IN SEVERAL WAYS. THE INSTITUTION HOSTED NUMEROUS FOCUS GROUPS AND COMMUNITY FORUMS WHICH FOCUSED ON SPECIFIC DISEASE PROCESSES, SPECIFIC PATIENT POPULATIONS (SUCH AS HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS OR THE ELDERLY), TYPES OF MEDICAL CARE AND PATIENT/RESIDENT/FAMILY-CENTERED CARE. OUR COMMUNITY HEALTH RISK SCREENING PROGRAM ASSESSES PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, BLOOD PRESSURE, OBESITY, TOBACCO USE, BLOOD GLUCOSE LEVELS AND OTHER RISK FACTORS FOR LOCAL RESIDENTS. ST. MARYS LEADERS SERVE ON BOARDS IN MANY COMMUNITY HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS AND THE BOARD MEMBERS INVITED TO SERVE WITH ST. MARYS ARE STRATEGICALLY SELECTED.PATIENT SATISFACTION SURVEYS ALSO PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION IN COMMUNITY BENEFIT PLANNING. A FEEDBACK LOOP HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR EMPLOYEES TO IDENTIFY UNMET NEEDS OF PATIENTS.IN ADDITION, WE UTILIZED DATA THAT IDENTIFIES KEY HEALTH ISSUES FOR THE DEMOGRAPHIC AREA WE SERVE. DATA WAS COMPILED FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES INCLUDING 2010 COUNTY PROFILE PUBLIC HEALTH STATISTICS, HEALTHY MAINE 2010 GOALS, STATEWIDE INITIATIVES FROM THE MAINE HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION, A LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM ASSESSMENT CONDUCTED IN 2009 BY THE MAINE CENTER FOR PUBLIC HEALTH AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS SUCH AS THE UNITED WAY, LEWISTON-AUBURN PUBLIC HEALTH INITIATIVE AND HEALTHY ANDROSCOGGIN. WE ALSO CONDUCT HEALTH CARE RISK SCREENINGS THROUGH OUR TAKE CHARGE PROGRAM AND THIS DATA SUPPORTS THE CONCERNS IDENTIFIED FROM OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT PLAN WAS DEVELOPED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMMUNITY BENEFIT STAFF, MISSION ADVISORY COMMITTEE, SYSTEM LEADERSHIP, SENIOR LEADERSHIP AND IN COORDINATION WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY AGENCIES SUCH AS LEWISTON-AUBURN PUBLIC HEALTH, HEALTHY ANDROSCOGGIN AND THE WESTERN MAINE DISTRICT PUBLIC HEALTH COORDINATING COUNCIL. THE PLAN HAS BEEN ENDORSED BY THE ST. MARYS HEALTH SYSTEM BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

PART VI, LINE 3: ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDES FINANCIAL EDUCATION AT THE POINT OF REGISTRATION BY HAVING BROCHURES AVAILABLE. THESE BROCHURES PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE HOSPITAL BILL AND VARIOUS OPTIONS ON FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE MONTHLY PATIENT STATEMENTS ALSO PROVIDES EDUCATION OF THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABILITY AND OPTIONS TO THOSE WHO NEED IT.

PART VI, LINE 4: ST. MARYS SERVICE AREA INCLUDES MOST OF ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY IN CENTRAL MAINE, WHICH IS APPROXIMATELY 42,000 HOUSEHOLDS (JUST OVER 106,000 PEOPLE). ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENTLY PUBLISHED CENSUS BUREAU ESTIMATES (FROM JULY 2009), THE DEMOGRAPHIC DISTRIBUTION IS: AGE GROUP0 TO 18 YEARS 26%18 TO 64 YEARS 59%65 YEARS AND OVER 15%13% OF FAMILIES LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVELRACE/ETHNICITYWHITE 95%BLACK/AFRICAN-AMERICAN 2.2%*OTHER 2.8%LANGUAGE SPOKEN AT HOMEENGLISH 84%OTHER THAN ENGLISH 16%*THE BLACK/AFRICAN AMERICAN POPULATION IN LEWISTON IS NOW 8.7% ACCORDING TO AN ARTICLE IN THE 3/25/11 LEWISTON SUN JOURNAL CITING INITIAL 2010 CENSUS BUREAU DATA.ST. MARYS REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER IS THE 5TH LARGEST HOSPITAL IN THE STATE OF MAINE. MAINECARE (A FEDERAL/STATE PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES HEALTH AND DENTAL INSURANCE ASSISTANCE TO PEOPLE WITH LIMITED RESOURCES) SERVES 20% OF THE TOTAL PATIENT POPULATION (THE HIGHEST UTILIZATION IN THE STATE), 40% ARE MEDICARE INSURED, 37% PRIVATE PAY AND 3% SELF-PAY. LEWISTON IS A FEDERALLY DESIGNATED MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED CITY.

PART VI, LINE 6: GOAL 1: PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO CARE FOR THE POOR AND VULNERABLE IN CENTRAL MAINE.A. PROVIDE FOOD TO THE POORCOMMUNITY STRATEGIES SUBSIDIZE NUTRITION CENTER PROGRAMMING IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY FOOD SYSTEM ACTION PLAN (A COMPREHENSIVE PLAN TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD FOR CONSUMERS, SUPPORT LOCAL PRODUCERS, AND CREATE SUSTAINABLE FOOD SYSTEM SOLUTIONS) THROUGH THE LOCAL FOOD FOR LEWISTON INITIATIVE WITH THE NUTRITION CENTER SERVING AS THE LEAD ORGANIZATIONB. FACILITATE ACCESS TO HEALTH-RELATED SERVICES COMMUNITY STRATEGIES PROVIDE FREE HEALTH SCREENINGS IN THE COMMUNITY PROVIDE VACCINATION CLINICS IN THE COMMUNITY AND SCHOOL BASED CLINICS PARTICIPATE AS A LEAD AGENCY IN COMMUNITY HEALTH SAFETY NET FOR LOCAL PLAN TO END HOMELESSNESS HOST COMMUNITY TOBACCO USE SUPPORT GROUP AND PROVIDE WRITTEN MATERIALS ABOUT TOBACCO CESSATION RESOURCES IN MAINE DEVELOP GREAT FALLS COLLABORATIVE (A COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP OF MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS TO IMPROVE COORDINATION OF CARE FOR MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES) SUBSIDIZE COMMUNITY SCHOOL COOPERATING WITH LEWISTON AND AUBURN SCHOOL SYSTEMS TO SERVE AT RISK YOUTH WITH EDUCATION, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY, AND SPEECH PATHOLOGY ADDRESS NEEDS OF MINORITY COMMUNITIES AND NEW MAINER POPULATIONGOAL 2: CREATE, PROMOTE AND PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS TO COMMUNITY GROUPS AND HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS. THESE PROGRAMS WILL ADDRESS THE SPECIFIC HEALTH CARE NEEDS IDENTIFIED FOR CENTRAL MAINE.STRATEGIES PROMOTE TAKECHARGE PROGRAM AND WEAR RED CAMPAIGN FOR CARDIAC HEALTH PROVIDE ENTREES TO HEALTH COMMUNITY EDUCATION SESSIONS ON CARDIAC HEALTH AND ONCOLOGY PROVIDE TOBACCO CESSATION CLASSES FOR COMMUNITY PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM RELATED TO NUTRITION AND COOKING FOR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE NUTRITION CENTER PROVIDE CARDIAC HEALTH EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH SESSIONS FOR HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS PROVIDE CLINICAL PLACEMENT FOR HEALTH CARE STUDENTS FROM LOCAL AND REGIONAL EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMSGOAL 3: ADDRESS CRITICAL PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERNS FOR ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY.A. ADDRESS CARDIAC-RELATED HEALTH CONCERNSCOMMUNITY STRATEGIES CONDUCT BLOOD PRESSURE SCREENINGS, COUNSELING AND EDUCATION AT COMMUNITY SITES HOST AN ANNUAL HEART FAIR SPONSOR AN ANNUAL HEART WALKB. ADDRESS CANCER-RELATED HEALTH CONCERNSCOMMUNITY STRATEGIES OFFER SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS TO COMMUNITY GROUPS PROVIDE COMMUNITY SKIN CANCER SCREENING PROVIDE COMMUNITY PROSTATE CANCER SCREENING PROVIDE WOMENS HEALTH SCREENING OFFER A STAFFED CANCER RESOURCE CENTER PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS AND PSYCHO-SOCIAL SUPPORT. C. ADDRESS OBESITY AND DIABETES-RELATED HEALTH CONCERNSCOMMUNITY STRATEGIES CONTINUE SLIDING SCALE FEE OF 0-100% WILL BE ESTABLISHED TO ENSURE ALL PARTICIPANTS CAN ACCESS THE MEAL PROGRAM IN THE WEIGHT MANAGEMENT PROGRAM OFFER PROGRAMS FOR HEALTHY EATING FOR CHILDREN AND TEENS THROUGH THE NUTRITION CENTER OFFER COMMUNITY SUPPORT GROUP FOR DIABETES MANAGEMENTD. ADDRESS MENTAL HEALTH/SUBSTANCE ABUSE HEALTH CONCERNSINTERNAL STRATEGIES EXPLORE REFERRAL PROCESS FOR MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS SUBSIDIZE INPATIENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM SUBSIDIZE INTENSIVE OUTPATIENT PROGRAM FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE SUBSIDIZE OUTPATIENT COUNSELING SERVICES SUPPORTING COMMUNITY PROVIDERS SUBSIDIZE THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPREHENSIVE BEHAVIORAL EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT IN MAINE WITH FOCUS ON BOTH ADULTS AND CHILDREN

PART VI, LINE 7: ST. MARY'S HEALTH SYSTEM, A MEMBER OF COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEMS, INCLUDES ST. MARY'S REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, A 233-BED ACUTE CARE FACILITY; ST. MARY'S PHYSICIAN NETWORK, WITH PRIMARY CARE AND SPECIALTY PHYSICIANS, PHYSICIAN ASSISTANTS, NURSE PRACTITIONERS, AND MIDWIVES; COMMUNITY CLINICAL SERVICES, WITH PRIMARY CARE AND BEHAVIORAL PHYSICIANS, AND NURSE PRACTITIONERS; ST. MARY'S DYOUVILLE PAVILION, ONE OF THE LARGEST NURSING HOMES NORTH OF BOSTON, WITH 210 BEDS DEDICATED TO LONG-TERM CARE, A SECURE ALZHEIMERS UNIT, AND A REHAB CENTER; ST. MARY'S RESIDENCES, AN INDEPENDENT LIVING CENTER; AND ST. MARY'S WORKMED, OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH SERVICES, WHICH PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE WORKSITE SERVICES TO BUSINESSES IN ANDROSCOGGIN COUNTY AND BEYOND. OUR MISSION IS TO CONTINUE THE HEALING MINISTRY OF THE CATHOLIC CHURCH IN THE SPIRIT OF ST. MARGUERITE D'YOUVILLE BY PROVIDING PREVENTIVE, CURATIVE, RESTORATIVE, AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES WITH COMPASSION AND RESPECT FOR EVERYONE. WE TAKE SERIOUSLY THE PREVENTIVE ASPECT OF THE MISSION STATEMENT BY OFFERING PREVENTION AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS FOR THE COMMUNITY, OFFER HEALTH SCREENINGS AND WORKING TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD THROUGH THE NUTRITION CENTER. THE NURSING HOME OFFERS EDUCATION TO THE COMMUNITY ABOUT FALL PREVENTION, GRIEF SUPPORT AND CAREGIVER SUPPORT. HEALTH SYSTEM LEADERSHIP PARTICIPATE IN VARIOUS COMMUNITY GROUPS TO CONDUCT HEALTH CARE NEEDS ASSESSMENTS AND TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY INTERVENTIONS TO IMPROVE HEALTH.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT, THE CEO OR THE CFO MAY AUTHORIZE PAYMENT OF SPOUSAL TRAVEL EXPENSES. THE PAYMENT OF SUCH AMOUNTS ARE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND REPORTED ON FORM W-2 OR 1099 AS REQUIRED. THE PRESIDENT RECEIVED TAX INDEMNIFICATION PAYMENTS RELATED TO A SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PAYMENTS ARE REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND INCLUDED IN THE REASONABLENESS REVIEW OF COMPENSATION. THE CEO RECEIVED TAX INDEMNIFICATION PAYMENTS RELATED TO A SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PAYMENTS ARE REPORTED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION AND INCLUDED IN THE REASONABLENESS REVIEW OF COMPENSATION.

LEO MYLES RECEIVED A SUPPLEMENTAL EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT PLAN CONTRIBUTION OF $182,000. THE AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES IN 2010. JAMES CASSIDY RECEIVED A SUPPLEMENTAL EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT PLAN CONTRIBUTION OF $136,381. THE AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES IN 2010.

IN CONJUNCTION WITH ITS SOLE MEMBER, COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEMS, THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS AN INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN FOR EXECUTIVES THAT IS ADMINISTERED BY COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEM'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE PLAN PROVIDES EXECUTIVES WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO EARN REASONABLE INCENTIVE COMPENSATION BASED ON THE PERFORMANCE OF THE INDIVIDUAL EXECUTIVE, AS MEASURED AGAINST GOALS THAT ARE SET AT THE BEGINNING OF THE YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GENERAL SURGERY, ORTHOPEDICS AND NEUROSURGERY WERE PRACTICES IN ST. MARYS HEALTH SYSTEM, WHICH BECAME PART OF ST. MARYS REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDER BASED PROGRAMS. THE COMMUNITY CLINICAL SERVICES INTERNAL MEDICINE PRACTICES, AND FAMILY PRACTICES, EXCEPT FOR THE B-STREET PRACTICE, ALSO BECAME PART OF ST. MARYS REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDER BASED PROGRAM IN 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER WHO MAY APPOINT OR REMOVE ONE OR MORE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CERTAIN DECISIONS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE MEMBERS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS AND REVIEWED AT THE JULY MEETING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THIS PROCESS IS THE RESONSIBILITY OF THE COMPLIANCE OFFICER. A FORM IS SUBMITTED TO ALL LEADERSHIP, BOARD MEMBERS, BOARD COMMITTEE MEMBERS, EMPLOYED PHYSICIANS, MEDICAL DIRECTORS AND CERTAIN EMPLOYEES IN KEY POSITIONS ANNUALLY TO BE COMPLETED. REMINDERS ARE SENT TO MAKE CERTAIN THAT ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE RETURNED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EVERY TWO TO THREE YEARS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEMS' BOARD OF DIRECTORS ENGAGES AN EXTERNAL CONSULTANT TO PROVIDE COMPETITIVE MARKET DATA FROM VARIOUS SURVEY SOURCES, WHICH IS USED TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES TO THE COMPENSATION PROGRAM. SINCE 2003, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HAS ENGAGED MERCER HUMAN RESOURCES CONSULTING TO CONDUCT THIS ANALYSIS. OBJECTIVES ARE TO ASSESS THE COMPOSITENESS OF THE CURRENT TOTAL CASH COMPENSATION LEVELS OF THE SENIOR LEADERSHIP TEAM; DEVELOP MARKET BASED COMPETITIVE SALARY RANGES FOR ALL EXECUTIVE POSITIONS AND ENSURE THAT THE ANNUAL INCENTIVE OPPORTUNITIES, IF THERE ARE ANY, ARE COMPETITIVE AND REASONABLE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FORM 990, FORM 990-T AND FORM 1023 TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT CURRENTLY PROVIDE ACCESS TO GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF COVENANT HEALTH SYSTEM ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.
